channel.title: [PI]Public Chat Notice?[PI]
channel.description: I want to make it for example if someone says: "How do I get barrows gloves?" It would do: [code]c.sendMessage("<col=255>You should do ::help barrows gloves");[/code] I know this would be in Chat.java, but I do not know how to put it.

item.title: [PI]Public Chat Notice?[PI]
item.dc:creator: @no1toldme2 no1toldme2
item.description:
@no1toldme2 wrote:

did you write that yourself :eek:. Lol u spelled packaging wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Public Chat Notice?[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

facepalm
I already have that command…
I want a message to show up if a person said that in public chat, they LEARN that the command is there, because they’re new and don’t know about it!! :mad:

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Public Chat Notice?[PI]
item.dc:creator: @belhelmiel belhelmiel
item.description:
@belhelmiel wrote:

[quote=“belhelmiel, post:2, topic:402428”][quote author=Impious Lols link=topic=499484.msg3652991#msg3652991 date=1309849270]
I want to make it for example if someone says:
“How do I get barrows gloves?”
It would do:

I know this would be in Chat.java, but I do not know how to put it.
[/quote]
A simpler way to do this is to add instructions on stuff like that. Make a booklet. It’s not very hard.[/quote]
Edit:
It’s not very hard and you wouldn’t have to type anything exactly right. What if they used different grammar than you did when you typed it? Or if they are telling someone what to type for help it wouldn’t work out right.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Public Chat Notice?[PI]
item.dc:creator: @nicke924 nicke924
item.description:
@nicke924 wrote:

if c.sendMessage(“How do I get barrows gloves”);
then
c2.sendMessage("<col=255>You should do ::help barrows gloves");
break; Just a guess xD

Read full topic
